name: Créer une API compatible OpenAI utilisant les modèles GitHub pour un accès AI gratuit
description:
### Ce modèle n8n vous montre comment connecter [les modèles gratuits de Github](https://docs.github.com/en/github-models) à vos workflows AI n8n existants.

Bien qu'il soit possible d'utiliser des nœuds HTTP pour accéder aux modèles Github, l'objectif de ce modèle est de l'utiliser avec les nœuds LLM n8n existants - ce qui évite le travail de refactorisation !

Veuillez noter que Github indique que leurs API de modèles ne sont pas destinées à un usage en production ! Si vous avez besoin de limites de taux plus élevées, vous devrez utiliser un service payant.

### Comment ça fonctionne
* L'approche construit une API compatible OpenAI personnalisée autour de l'API des modèles Github - tout cela fait dans n8n !
* Tout d'abord, nous attachons un sous-nœud OpenAI à notre nœud LLM et configurons un nouvel identifiant OpenAI.
* Dans ce nouvel identifiant OpenAI, nous changeons l'"URL de base" pour pointer vers un webhook n8n que nous avons préparé dans le cadre de ce modèle.
* Ensuite, nous créons 2 webhooks avec lesquels le nœud LLM tentera maintenant de se connecter : "modèles" et "complétion de chat".
* Le webhook "modèles" appelle simplement le point de terminaison "lister tous les modèles" du modèle Github et remappe la réponse pour être compatible avec notre nœud LLM.
* Le webhook "Complétion de Chat" effectue une tâche similaire avec le point de terminaison de Complétion de Chat de Github.

### Comment utiliser
* Une fois connecté, ouvrez simplement le chat et posez vos questions !
* Tout nœud LLM ou agent AI connecté avec ce sous-nœud LLM personnalisé enverra des requêtes à l'API des modèles Github. Vous permettant d'essayer une gamme de modèles SOTA gratuitement.

### Exigences
* Compte Github et identifiants pour accéder aux modèles. Si vous avez déjà utilisé le nœud Github auparavant, vous pouvez réutiliser cet identifiant pour ce modèle.

### Personnalisation de ce workflow
* Ce modèle n'est qu'un exemple. Utilisez l'identifiant OpenAI personnalisé pour vos autres workflows afin de tester les modèles Github.

### Références
* [https://docs.github.com/en/github-models/prototyping-with-ai-models](https://docs.github.com/en/github-models/prototyping-with-ai-models)
* [https://docs.github.com/en/github-models](https://docs.github.com/en/github-models)

parameters.content:
### LLM Models via N8N Webhooks
1. Create a new OpenAI Credential and call it "n8n-webhook"
2. Enter API key as anything you like eg. "12345"
3. Enter Base URL as "https://<your_n8n_url>/webhook/github-models"
4. Activate your workflow! This only really works with the production webhook URL.

Feel free to change the names to whatever you want, just make sure the LLM node is able to reach it!

## 1. Create a New Custom OpenAI Credential
[Learn more about OpenAI Credentials](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/openai/)

To use Github Models with our existing n8n nodes, one approach is to mimic an openAI compatible API connected through the OpenAI model subnode. Sounds complicated but don't worry, this template shows you how! The first step is to setup a new OpenAI credential so that we can change the Base URL.

## 2. Listing All Available Models 
[Read more about the Webhook Trigger node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.webhook/)

Our first endpoint is for listing all models. The Github Models API how we can do this but the response requires some re-mapping to make it compatible with our LLM node.

## 3. Request a Chat Completion 
[Read more about the HTTP Request node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.httprequest)

Our second endpoint is for executing a chat completion. Note that depending on if you have connected with an agent, the response expected is a "stream" and returned data needs to be of type `text/plain`.

## Try It Out!
### This n8n template shows you how to connect [Github's Free Models](https://docs.github.com/en/github-models) to your existing n8n AI workflows.

Whilst it is possible to use HTTP nodes to access Github Models, The aim of this template is to use it with existing n8n LLM nodes - saves the trouble of refactoring!

Please note, Github states their model APIs are not intended for production usage! If you need higher rate limits, you'll need to use a paid service.

### How it works
* The approach builds a custom OpenAI compatible API around the Github Models API - all done in n8n!
* First, we attach an OpenAI subnode to our LLM node and configure a new OpenAI credential.
* Within this new OpenAI credential, we change the "Base URL" to point at a n8n webhook we've prepared as part of this template.
* Next, we create 2 webhooks which the LLM node will now attempt to connect with: "models" and "chat completion".
* The "models" webhook simply calls the Github Model's "list all models" endpoint and remaps the response to be compatible with our LLM node.
* The "Chat Completion" webhook does a similar task with Github's Chat Completion endpoint.

### How to use
* Once connected, just open chat and ask away!
* Any LLM or AI agent node connected with this custom LLM subnode will send requests to the Github Models API. Allowing your to try out a range of SOTA models for free.

### Requirements
* Github account and credentials for access to Models. If you've used the Github node previously, you can reuse this credential for this template.

### Customising this workflow
* This template is just an example. Use the custom OpenAI credential for your other workflows to test Github models.

### References
* [https://docs.github.com/en/github-models/prototyping-with-ai-models](https://docs.github.com/en/github-models/prototyping-with-ai-models)
* [https://docs.github.com/en/github-models](https://docs.github.com/en/github-models)

### Need Help?
Join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d) or ask in the [Forum](https://community.n8n.io/)!

Happy Hacking!

user.name: Jimleuk
user.bio:
Freelance AI Automation Engineer based in London, UK. Since 2024, my n8n templates have documented my journey into applied AI and have helped hundreds of businesses and organisations get up to speed with AI automation. Today, I continue to explore use-cases as AI evolves and occasionally upload templates which I find novel and interesting.

Subscribe to the RSS Feed: https://cdn.subworkflow.ai/n8n-templates/rss.xml

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
